title: Crafts in Yackandandah
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Victoria - Rural conditions
Crafts & Visual Arts/Arts and crafts movement
Economics, Philosophy, Politics, Religion & Sociology/Country life - Australia
Food, Health, Lifestyle, Medicine, Psychology & Safety/Country life - Psychological aspects
abstract: The craftspeople and artists who call Yackandandah home.  Filmed as part of 'ACMI in the Regions: Stories from Indigo'.
description: Inspired by the changing landscape, the availability of raw materials and a sense of community, various talented crafts practitioners call Yackandandah home. From internationally recognised potter John Dermer and local weaver Jan Clements, to Christine Thorpe owner of Spiritus Gallery we are introduced to wood carvers, guitar makers and jewellery designers.
